Description.div: Page number to retrieve. Page numbers are 1-based (the first page number is 1).

Reference to an existing page result to extract data from. If it doesn't exist, this token will be used to identify a new set of pages. This attribute is only used when the PaginationStrategy is GENERIC.

Option.Description: Page data from any List API by executing the API normally and post-processing the results.
Uses database-specific SQL commands to fetch a specific page of data. Note this is not supported on all databases.
Retrieves data from the database up to and including the requested page, then discards the unused portion.
Given a reference to the last record of a page of data, returns the next page by manipulating the SQL where clause.
Discard any results associated with the PageSetToken and re-execute the API.
Return data from a cache if available

Description.div: Row number of the first record in the page. This StartRowNumber takes precedence over the PageNumber attribute when determining how to retrieve records. Row numbers are 0-based (the first row number is 0).

Attribute.Name: XMLPath
Attribute.Description:
Path of the parent output XML element whose children will be paged. For example, the User elements in the following XML will be paged when an XMLPath of /UserList is given.
<Organization> <UserList> <User Loginid="User1"/> <User Loginid="User2"/> </UserList> </Organization> Note if the XMLPath is not found in the output, the output of getPage will be marked as invalid.
This attribute is only supported for the GENERIC PaginationStrategy. The default behavior is to select the root element. To explicitly select the root element, use a single slash (/).

Description.div:
Paginate an API.
If PaginationStrategy is not GENERIC or ROWNUM or RESULTSET or NEXTPAGE
Search for a page of data that contains this record. Unique identifiers for the record must be given.
The page number of the page represented by this data. If this attribute is given and the data is found, the resulting page number will be one greater than this one.
Find a page of data immediately following this record. Unique identifiers for the record must be given.
Set value to Y only if paginating a service. (NOTE: Only 'GENERIC' strategy is supported while paginating a Service.)
Name of the API to call.
Version number of the API. Only provide a value if a specific version of the API is needed.
